title: How to Remove Rubber Cement from Carpet

steps.headline: Sponge the area using a little portion of dry-cleaning solvent.
steps.description: Do not rub, simply blot. Always keep the dry-cleaning solvent amount very small, in case it interferes with the carpet backing or the fibers).

steps.headline: Make a mixture of one tablespoon of a mild, gentle detergent with 236 milliliters (8  fl oz) of warm water.
Blot the mixture over the rubber cement stain.
Use clean water as a rinse.
steps.description: Use another clean sponge and once again, simply blot.

text: Sponge the area using a little portion of dry-cleaning solvent. Do not rub, simply blot. Always keep the dry-cleaning solvent amount very small, in case it interferes with the carpet backing or the fibers). Make a mixture of one tablespoon of a mild, gentle detergent with 236 milliliters (8  fl oz) of warm water.  Blot the mixture over the rubber cement stain.  Use clean water as a rinse. Use another clean sponge and once again, simply blot.
